meanings.definition: To cry and sniffle in a feeble or fretful way.
meanings.sent1: The child was snivelling after falling off the swing.
meanings.sent2: She was snivelling quietly in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: Even the smallest puppy couldn't help but snivel when it lost its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The old man's heart snivelled with sorrow as he watched the sunset alone.
meanings.sent5: The sound of snivelling echoed through the empty hallway, a lonely melody of sadness.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a snivelling coward; stand up for yourself!
meanings.sent2: The bully always targeted the snivelling kids in school.
meanings.sent3: The snivelling character in the movie provided comic relief with their constant whining.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself reflected in the mirror, a snivelling shadow of who she used to be.
meanings.sent5: The snivelling beggar on the street corner tugged at the hearts of passersby with his tearful pleas.
